title: rs.isMesh returns 'module' object has no attribute 'isMesh'
question:
While calling isMesh() I get the error: 
'module' object has no attribute 'isMesh'


import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs

def SplitJoinedMeshes():
    lastObjectCount = -1
    objectCount = 0
    
    while lastObjectCount != objectCount:
        aObjects = rs.AllObjects()
        lastObjectCount = objectCount
        objectCount = len(aObjects)
    
        for obj in aObjects:
            print rs.ObjectType(obj)
            
            if rs.isMesh(obj):
                rs.SplitBrep(obj)

    scriptcontext.doc.Views.Redraw()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    SplitJoinedMeshes()



Why is this happening?  The print statement above my call to 
isMesh()
 returns 32, which indicates a mesh.  I am using Rhino 7.
